events.message: Customer reported a car collision involving their vehicle on the highway during rush hour.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial details submitted.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to oversee the claim processing and contact the customer.
Customer received confirmation from the insurer acknowledging the receipt of their auto accident claim.
The insurer requested photos of the damaged vehicle, the police report, and repair estimates to proceed.
Customer submitted required documents including pictures of the damage and the official police report.
Investigation into the accident claim began with a review of submitted documents and contacting involved parties.
The investigation concluded that the claimant was not at fault and the damage was consistent with the reported accident.
A settlement offer covering full repair costs and a rental car reimbursement was sent to the customer for approval.
Customer positively responded to the settlement offer, expressing satisfaction with the proposed compensation.
Claim was officially approved based on investigation results and acceptance of the settlement by the claimant.
Payment for the settlement amount was issued to the claimant's account to cover repair costs and other expenses.
The claim was officially closed following the successful payout and positive feedback from the customer.
All claim documents and correspondence have been archived for future reference and audit purposes.
